TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ father , PERSON , sold his CARDINAL houses which were situated in the GPE district to his sons in DATE , respectively , by a notary deed . He transferred the possession of the land on which the houses were located to the applicants ; however , this land was not registered in the title deeds at that time . The applicants requested that the land be divided into CARDINAL parts by LOC . Subsequently , GPE acceded to their request on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were issued with title deeds for the plots of land numbered CARDINAL and CARDINAL in GPE , following a cadastral survey conducted in the region .
CARDINAL . In DATE , a general survey of coastal districts carried out by ORG defined the ORG plots of land and houses as falling within the coastline area .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG brought an action against the applicants before ORG for the annulment of their title deeds on the ground that their land was located within the coastline area . They claimed that , according to LAW of DATE , the land in question could not be owned by an individual , but could only be used in the public interest .

CARDINAL . On DATE a group of experts , composed of a geomorphologist , a cartography engineer and an agricultural engineer , appointed by the court , inspected the applicants’ land and concluded that it was located within the coastline area .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court upheld the request of the ORG and annulled the applicants’ ownership in the title deed registry .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ requests for an appeal and rectification of this judgment were rejected by ORG on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP On unspecified dates , the ORG brought further actions against the applicants , for injunctions to prevent any intervention ( müdahelenin men - i ve kal davası ) by the applicants on the disputed land and the destruction of the adjoining houses . On DATE ORG Instance accepted this request in relation to the first applicant . This decision has not yet been finalised . The action against the second applicant is still pending before the same court .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is set out in the ORG ’s judgments in the similar cases of ORG and Others v GPE ( no . ORG , § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) , and PERSON and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § DATE ) .
